properties.NAME: Mud Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: Salt marsh reconnected and forage fish spawning beach restored by removing nearly 300 linear feet of a low lying road and associated armoring, fill and culvert.

properties.NAME: Eastsound Waterfront Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Beach and riparian restoration through removal of a derelict concrete structure, intertidal rock and debris cleanup, and shoreline planting. Set to be completed in Fall 2025.

properties.NAME: West Sound Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: 150 waterfront feet of pocket beach habitat restored by removing a large rock and creosote bulkhead.

properties.NAME: Neck Point Coves
properties.DESCRIPTION: Two-acre wetland reconnected to marine waters through channel restoration and removal of fill.

properties.NAME: Neck Point
properties.DESCRIPTION: Consisting of 500 feet of a documented forage fish spawning site, this beach will be restored through removal of an unnecessary bulkhead as well as a cleanup of intertidal debris. Set to be completed in Fall 2025.

properties.NAME: Broken Point
properties.DESCRIPTION: A 230-foot creosote wood bulkhead and associated rock and fill that extended well over the intertidal beach were removed to restore the historic beach, backshore habitat and improve water quality.

properties.NAME: Smuggler's Cove Road
properties.DESCRIPTION: 300 linear feet of shoreline, at a known surf smelt spawning beach, was improved by reducing the footprint of the road protection, removing unnatural large rock from the intertidal beach, and nourishing with sand and fine gravel.

properties.NAME: Blind Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: 600 waterfront feet of forage fish spawning habitat enhanced by intertidal rock and debris removal and beach nourishment (2017). 340 additional adjacent feet were enhanced in 2019.

properties.NAME: Thatcher Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: 200 waterfront feet of subtidal and intertidal habitat restored at a known forage fish spawning beach by removing an outdated log handling facility and rebuilding an existing barge landing into a smaller footprint.

properties.NAME: Upright Head
properties.DESCRIPTION: Documented forage fish spawning habitat restoration through removal of shoreline armor and concrete debris from the intertidal beach. Set to be completed in Fall 2026.

properties.NAME: Shoal Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: Five-acre coastal lagoon habitat, water quality and fish passage improved by removing concrete tide gate and fill from the tide channel.

properties.NAME: Shoal Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: 100 waterfront feet of forage fish beach spawning habitat restored by removing creosote and concrete.

properties.NAME: Fisherman Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: 400 waterfront feet of salt marsh and tidal channel habitat restored through removal of outdated rock and wood ditches, dikes, and berms.

properties.NAME: Barlow Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: Eelgrass and forage fish habitat restored by removing a derelict dock, including 1,200 square feet of overwater structure, 26 creosote pilings, pier decking, and 26 cubic yards of rock and fill.

properties.NAME: Salmon Point
properties.DESCRIPTION: Critical habitat along a 430 foot long pocket beach is improved through shoreline plantings (2020) and removal of degraded rock armoring and concrete/rock debris.

properties.NAME: Turn Point
properties.DESCRIPTION: 200 waterfront feet of beach and salt marsh habitat restored by removing an unnecessary rock bulkhead.

properties.NAME: Brown Island
properties.DESCRIPTION: 250 waterfront feet of bluff and beach restored by removing an unnecessary rock bulkhead.
